intro: Polygonatum × mediobracteatum, commonly known as the hybrid yellow flag. It is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Asparagaceae family, characterized by its long, creeping rhizomes and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and wetlands. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often forming dense mats along the ground. The flowers are usually borne in terminal clusters and are pollinated primarily by insects.
